intro: Eriospora abyssinica var. castanea, commonly known as the Abyssinian eriospora, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface and a slightly serrated edge. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species with limited research on its ecological role.
